document.docAuthor: Huo, Qing-bo, Zhu, Bin-Qing & Du, Yu-Zhou
document.masterDocTitle: New illustrations, new species and new combination of Hemacroneuria Enderlein (Plecoptera: Perlidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New illustrations, new species and new combination of Hemacroneuria Enderlein (Plecoptera: Perlidae) from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hemacroneuria violacea :
Enderlein 1909: 395
. Holotype male: Tonkin , Vietnam .

subSubSection.paragraph: — Stark & Sivec 2008: 174 — Murányi & Li 2016: 189 — Yang & Li 2018: 46 .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Acroneuria violacea : Zwick 1973: 491
—
Du, Sivec & He 1999: 63
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Male, A: habitus (dorsal and ventral); B: head and pronotum.

FIGURE 2.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Male, A: wings; B: an aberrant male with forewing shorter but bearing more cross veins apically.

subSubSection.paragraph: Supplementary description: Adult wings nearly black with metallic green and blue luster. Body generally black, with similar luster to wings, except the ventral arolium, ventral first two tarsomeres, and membranous junction between the ventral thoracic segments are bright yellowish ( Figs. 1–6 ).

Adult male: Aedeagus membranous, composed of a long, thick tube at base, the apex abruptly expanded to a wide stem with two pairs of lateral arms and one apical lobe (partially extruded). The apical lobe bears many distinct transverse wrinkles and thick hairs. Much of the aedeagal surface covered with ventral microtrichia and cuticular asperities ( Fig. 4 ).
Adult female: Shape of the subgenital plate in our materials same as the figures in Zwick (1973 , Fig. 6 ).

Egg: Length ca. 0.47 mm , width ca. 0.34 mm . Outline chicken-egg shaped, collar small, projecting well above posterior pole. Chorion coarsely punctate throughout, without ridges; a paler ring lacking punctations near anterior pole ( Fig. 6 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Male abdomen, A: dorsal; B: ventral.

FIGURE 4.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Male, A: terminalia; B: hammer; C: aedeagus, dorsal; D: aedeagus, ventral.

FIGURE 5.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Female, A: habitus (dorsal and ventral); B: head and pronotum.

FIGURE 6.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Female, A–B: subgenital plate, two viations; C: mature egg; D: immature eggs.

FIGURE 7.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Shed skin, A: habitus; B: mandible; C: lacinia; D: labium, ventral.

FIGURE 8.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. Nymph, A: head and pronotum; B: winpads; C: mouthpart, ventral; D: thoraxal gills, ventral; E–F: terminalia, dorsal and ventral; G: paraprocts, ventral.

FIGURE 9.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Fujian. A–B: adults in/after emerging; C: stream in Wuyi Mountains, the habitat.

FIGURE 10.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Guangxi. Male and female habitus with original collecting labels.

FIGURE 11.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Guangxi, male and female terminalia (materials checked by Ignac Sivec). A–B: male tergaum 7–10, dorsal and ventral; C: female, subgenital plate, ventral.

FIGURE 12.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Guizhou, male. A: habitus (photo taken by Hu Zheng-Kun); B: head and pronotum; C–D: male terminalia, dorsal and ventral.

FIGURE 13.
Hemacroneuria violacea
from Guizhou, male. A: tergum 10 and paraprocts, caudal view; B: hammer; C–E: aedeagus, dorsal, ventral, caudal in difference views.

subSubSection.paragraph: Lacinia triangular, bidentate, five coarse spines below the second tooth, a row of long fine hair from base of spines to articulation of lacinia. Mandible with five stout, short cusps, from basal cusps three rows of stout spines occupy the molar region, two extending on the ventral surface and a third composed of longer spines on the medial surface. Paraglossae flat, inverted triangular, ca. twice the length of glossae. Glossa short, apex with thick fine hairs.

Material examined:
8♂♂ , 4♀♀ , 2 nymphs, 10 shed skins, China , Fujian Province , Wuyishan City , Mount Wuyi ( Wuyishan ), on the way from Saiyan to Tongmu Village ,
726m
, 27°44'46"N , 117°40'29"E ,
2021-IV-13
, leg. Huo
Qing-Bo, Xiang Ya-Nan , Zhu Bin-Qing, Chen Zhi-Qiang
;
1♂ , 1♀ , China , Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region ,, Jinxiu Yao Autonomous County , “Jinzhong highway”,
1100m
,
1999-V-10
, leg. Xiao Hui
;
1♂ , China , Guizhou Province , Tongren City , Mount Fanjing ( Fanjingshan ), Yamugou stream, 27.80°N , 108.73°E ,
2019-VI-9
, leg. Hu Zheng-Kun
;
1♂ , China , Guangdong Province , Shaoguan City , Nanling National Forest Park , 2021 (specimen picked from a collection of local Malaise trap , data and collector unknown)
.
Distribution: China ( Fujian , newly recorded in Guangdong , Guangxi and Guizhou ); Vietnam .

Remarks: This work is the first to describe the nymph of
H. violacea
. Mandible of nymphs share the same shape with
Hemacroneuria marginalis Stark & Sivec, 2008
. The interspecific differences are not apparent based on mouthparts. When this species emerges it is easily collected from rocks and bridges by streams ( Fig. 9 ). Specimens from the four geographical populations from China showed no visible intraspecific differences in morphology.
